 ------------------- start of mail -------------------   
 From : ocTEL 2014 <octel@alt.ac.uk>  
 To   : h p cawthorne <h.p.cawthorne@sheffield.ac.uk>  
 Subject : Your New User Account Information on ocTEL 2014 
   ------------------- plaintext -------------------  
 ocTEL 2014
Open Course in Technology Enhanced Learning

* ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ *
! Your New User Account Information on ocTEL 2014 !
* ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ *
May 5, 2014



	Hello – a warm welcome from everyone at ocTEL! 

	We’ve called this Week 0 of the course because it’s a – hopefully – fairly gentle introduction to how the course works, the range of experiences you can expect, and how you can ‘design’ your own path through it to meet your needs. 

	I’m the lead tutor for this week (there are different tutors for each week), and I’m aiming to show you the ropes. I look forward to our exchanges in our various online spaces and in Wednesday’s webinar.    

	So, first, here is a brief summary of things you need to know to get the most of the course and make it work for you. 

	all the best, David Jennings. 

	First things first 

	What we will do: 
	* 

	Each week you will receive an email providing you with an overview of the week ahead. 
	* 

	You will also automatically receive details of the weekly webinar, including the link to join. The link to the recording will be posted online on the same day; 

	​ Accessing the ocTEL Site

	ocTEL aims to accommodate your communication preferences as far as possible and is not limited to the spaces provided in the ocTEL site, so wherever you feel most comfortable writing — as long as it is not behind a password login — we will do our best to collect it up and add it to the general mix. To allow use to collect these contribution please use the #ocTEL tag. You can find out more about how this works in our ocTEL Participants’ Handbook http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/?utm_source=mailpress&utm_medium=email_link&utm_content=__40&utm_campaign=2014-05-04T23:29:44+00:00handbook/ 

	Spaces are provided on the ocTEL website for discussion and for you to connect and share your experiences with other ocTEL participants. The majority of these can be viewed without a password. If you would like to contribute a website account has already been created for you and can accessed at http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/?utm_source=mailpress&utm_medium=email_link&utm_content=__40&utm_campaign=2014-05-04T23:29:44+00:00 [http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/?utm_source=mailpress&utm_medium=email_link&utm_content=__40&utm_campaign=2014-05-04T23:29:44+00:00] with 
	* Username: hadders 
	* Password: YxZzSmIoOu 

	If you have any problems doing this please contact octel-tech@alt.ac.uk. 

	If you wish to join a public email list to discuss the course there are separate instructions for joining octel-public@jiscmail.ac.uk. 

	Visit http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/?utm_source=mailpress&utm_medium=email_link&utm_content=__40&utm_campaign=2014-05-04T23:29:44+00:00 [http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/?utm_source=mailpress&utm_medium=email_link&utm_content=__40&utm_campaign=2014-05-04T23:29:44+00:00] for this week’s course material. 

	We hope you enjoy the course!
 OCTEL TEAM 

							this mail is brought to you by MailPress

View [http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/newsletter-subscriptions/?view=2bed4169178e7bf34359632a889595cf&id=40]
Unsubscribe [http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/newsletter-subscriptions/?del=2bed4169178e7bf34359632a889595cf] 

 ------------------- text/html -------------------  
 <p>Hello &#8211; a warm welcome from everyone at ocTEL!</p>
<p>We’ve called this Week 0 of the course because it’s a – hopefully – fairly gentle introduction to how the course works, the range of experiences you can expect, and how you can ‘design’ your own path through it to meet your needs.</p>
<p>I’m the lead tutor for this week (there are different tutors for each week), and I’m aiming to show you the ropes. I look forward to our exchanges in our various online spaces and in Wednesday’s webinar.   </p>
<p>So, first, here is a brief summary of things you need to know to get the most of the course and make it work for you.</p>
<p>all the best, David Jennings.</p>
<p>First things first</p>
<p>What we will do:</p>
<ul>
<li>
<p>Each week you will receive an email providing you with an overview of the week ahead.</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>You will also automatically receive details of the weekly webinar, including the link to join. The link to the recording will be posted online on the same day;</p>
</li>
</ul>
<p>​</p>
<h2>Accessing the ocTEL Site<br />
</h2>
<p>ocTEL aims to accommodate your communication preferences as far as possible and is not limited to the spaces provided in the <a href=http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/ target=_blank>ocTEL site</a>, so wherever you feel most comfortable writing &#8212; as long as it is not behind a password login &#8212; we will do our best to collect it up and add it to the general mix. To allow use to collect these contribution please use the #ocTEL tag. You can find out more about how this works in our <a href=http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/handbook/ target=_blank>ocTEL Participants’ Handbook</a> http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/handbook/</p>
<p>Spaces are provided on the ocTEL website for discussion and for you to connect and share your experiences with other ocTEL participants. The majority of these can be viewed without a password. If you would like to contribute a website account has already been created for you and can accessed at <a href="http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/?utm_source=mailpress&utm_medium=email_link&utm_content=__40&utm_campaign=2014-05-04T23:29:44+00:00">http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/</a> with </p>
<ul>
<li>Username: hadders</li>
<li>Password: YxZzSmIoOu</li>
</ul>
<p>If you have any problems doing this please contact <a href=mailto:octe-tech@alt.ac.uk target=_blank>octel-tech@alt.ac.uk</a>. </p>
<p>If you wish to join a public email list to discuss the course there are separate <a href=mailto:octel-public@jiscmail.ac.uk target=_blank>instructions for joining octel-public@jiscmail.ac.uk</a>.</p>
<p>Visit <a href="http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/?utm_source=mailpress&utm_medium=email_link&utm_content=__40&utm_campaign=2014-05-04T23:29:44+00:00">http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/</a> for this week’s course material.</p>
<p>We hope you enjoy the course!<br/> <strong>ocTEL team</strong></p> 

 ------------------ end of mail ------------------

 ocTEL 2014
Open Course in Technology Enhanced Learning

* ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ *
! Your New User Account Information on ocTEL 2014 !
* ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ *
May 5, 2014



	Hello – a warm welcome from everyone at ocTEL! 

	We’ve called this Week 0 of the course because it’s a – hopefully – fairly gentle introduction to how the course works, the range of experiences you can expect, and how you can ‘design’ your own path through it to meet your needs. 

	I’m the lead tutor for this week (there are different tutors for each week), and I’m aiming to show you the ropes. I look forward to our exchanges in our various online spaces and in Wednesday’s webinar.    

	So, first, here is a brief summary of things you need to know to get the most of the course and make it work for you. 

	all the best, David Jennings. 

	First things first 

	What we will do: 
	* 

	Each week you will receive an email providing you with an overview of the week ahead. 
	* 

	You will also automatically receive details of the weekly webinar, including the link to join. The link to the recording will be posted online on the same day; 

	​ Accessing the ocTEL Site

	ocTEL aims to accommodate your communication preferences as far as possible and is not limited to the spaces provided in the ocTEL site, so wherever you feel most comfortable writing — as long as it is not behind a password login — we will do our best to collect it up and add it to the general mix. To allow use to collect these contribution please use the #ocTEL tag. You can find out more about how this works in our ocTEL Participants’ Handbook http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/?utm_source=mailpress&utm_medium=email_link&utm_content=__41&utm_campaign=2014-05-04T23:29:46+00:00handbook/ 

	Spaces are provided on the ocTEL website for discussion and for you to connect and share your experiences with other ocTEL participants. The majority of these can be viewed without a password. If you would like to contribute a website account has already been created for you and can accessed at http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/?utm_source=mailpress&utm_medium=email_link&utm_content=__41&utm_campaign=2014-05-04T23:29:46+00:00 [http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/?utm_source=mailpress&utm_medium=email_link&utm_content=__41&utm_campaign=2014-05-04T23:29:46+00:00] with 
	* Username: t.adachi 
	* Password: UbJhPaZwKl 

	If you have any problems doing this please contact octel-tech@alt.ac.uk. 

	If you wish to join a public email list to discuss the course there are separate instructions for joining octel-public@jiscmail.ac.uk. 

	Visit http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/?utm_source=mailpress&utm_medium=email_link&utm_content=__41&utm_campaign=2014-05-04T23:29:46+00:00 [http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/?utm_source=mailpress&utm_medium=email_link&utm_content=__41&utm_campaign=2014-05-04T23:29:46+00:00] for this week’s course material. 

	We hope you enjoy the course!
 OCTEL TEAM

 <p>Hello &#8211; a warm welcome from everyone at ocTEL!</p>
<p>We’ve called this Week 0 of the course because it’s a – hopefully – fairly gentle introduction to how the course works, the range of experiences you can expect, and how you can ‘design’ your own path through it to meet your needs.</p>
<p>I’m the lead tutor for this week (there are different tutors for each week), and I’m aiming to show you the ropes. I look forward to our exchanges in our various online spaces and in Wednesday’s webinar.   </p>
<p>So, first, here is a brief summary of things you need to know to get the most of the course and make it work for you.</p>
<p>all the best, David Jennings.</p>
<p>First things first</p>
<p>What we will do:</p>
<ul>
<li>

</li>
<li>
<p>You will also automatically receive details of the weekly webinar, including the link to join. The link to the recording will be posted online on the same day;</p>
</li>
</ul>
<p>​</p>

<p>ocTEL aims to accommodate your communication preferences as far as possible and is not limited to the spaces provided in the <a href=http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/ target=_blank>ocTEL site</a>, so wherever you feel most comfortable writing &#8212; as long as it is not behind a password login &#8212; we will do our best to collect it up and add it to the general mix. You can find out more about how this works in our <a href=http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/handbook/ target=_blank>ocTEL Participants’ Handbook</a> http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/handbook/</p>
<p>Spaces are provided on the ocTEL website for discussion and for you to connect and share your experiences with other ocTEL participants. The majority of these can be viewed without a password.    ------------------- plaintext -------------------  
 ocTEL 2014
Open Course in Technology Enhanced Learning

* ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ *
! Your New User Account Information on ocTEL 2014 !
* ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ *
May 5, 2014



	Hello – a warm welcome from everyone at ocTEL! 

	We’ve called this Week 0 of the course because it’s a – hopefully – fairly gentle introduction to how the course works, the range of experiences you can expect, and how you can ‘design’ your own path through it to meet your needs. 

	I’m the lead tutor for this week (there are different tutors for each week), and I’m aiming to show you the ropes. I look forward to our exchanges in our various online spaces and in Wednesday’s webinar.    

	So, first, here is a brief summary of things you need to know to get the most of the course and make it work for you. 

	all the best, David Jennings. 

	First things first 

	What we will do: 
	* 

	Each week you will receive an email providing you with an overview of the week ahead. 
	* 

	You will also automatically receive details of the weekly webinar, including the link to join. The link to the recording will be posted online on the same day; 

	​ Accessing the ocTEL Site

	ocTEL aims to accommodate your communication preferences as far as possible and is not limited to the spaces provided in the ocTEL site, so wherever you feel most comfortable writing — as long as it is not behind a password login — we will do our best to collect it up and add it to the general mix. To allow use to collect these contribution please use the #ocTEL tag. You can find out more about how this works in our ocTEL Participants’ Handbook http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/?utm_source=mailpress&utm_medium=email_link&utm_content=__43&utm_campaign=2014-05-04T23:29:51+00:00handbook/ 

	Spaces are provided on the ocTEL website for discussion and for you to connect and share your experiences with other ocTEL participants. The majority of these can be viewed without a password. If you would like to contribute a website account has already been created for you and can accessed at http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/?utm_source=mailpress&utm_medium=email_link&utm_content=__43&utm_campaign=2014-05-04T23:29:51+00:00 [http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/?utm_source=mailpress&utm_medium=email_link&utm_content=__43&utm_campaign=2014-05-04T23:29:51+00:00] with 
	* Username: Cfoxcavan 
	* Password: DjJzLoBsYh 

	If you have any problems doing this please contact octel-tech@alt.ac.uk. 

	If you wish to join a public email list to discuss the course there are separate instructions for joining octel-public@jiscmail.ac.uk. 

	Visit http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/?utm_source=mailpress&utm_medium=email_link&utm_content=__43&utm_campaign=2014-05-04T23:29:51+00:00 [http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/?utm_source=mailpress&utm_medium=email_link&utm_content=__43&utm_campaign=2014-05-04T23:29:51+00:00] for this week’s course material. 

	We hope you enjoy the course!
 OCTEL TEAM 

							this mail is brought to you by MailPress

View [http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/newsletter-subscriptions/?view=dfdf4a18f004024fa57e7a6d2f9637a0&id=43]
Unsubscribe [http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/newsletter-subscriptions/?del=dfdf4a18f004024fa57e7a6d2f9637a0] 

 ------------------- text/html -------------------  
 <p>Hello &#8211; a warm welcome from everyone at ocTEL!</p>
<p>We’ve called this Week 0 of the course because it’s a – hopefully – fairly gentle introduction to how the course works, the range of experiences you can expect, and how you can ‘design’ your own path through it to meet your needs.</p>
<p>I’m the lead tutor for this week (there are different tutors for each week), and I’m aiming to show you the ropes. I look forward to our exchanges in our various online spaces and in Wednesday’s webinar.   </p>
<p>So, first, here is a brief summary of things you need to know to get the most of the course and make it work for you.</p>
<p>all the best, David Jennings.</p>
<p>First things first</p>
<p>What we will do:</p>
<ul>
<li>
<p>Each week you will receive an email providing you with an overview of the week ahead.</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>You will also automatically receive details of the weekly webinar, including the link to join. The link to the recording will be posted online on the same day;</p>
</li>
</ul>
<p>​</p>
<h2>Accessing the ocTEL Site<br />
</h2>
<p>ocTEL aims to accommodate your communication preferences as far as possible and is not limited to the spaces provided in the <a href=http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/ target=_blank>ocTEL site</a>, so wherever you feel most comfortable writing &#8212; as long as it is not behind a password login &#8212; we will do our best to collect it up and add it to the general mix. To allow use to collect these contribution please use the #ocTEL tag. You can find out more about how this works in our <a href=http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/handbook/ target=_blank>ocTEL Participants’ Handbook</a> http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/handbook/</p>
<p>Spaces are provided on the ocTEL website for discussion and for you to connect and share your experiences with other ocTEL participants. The majority of these can be viewed without a password. If you would like to contribute a website account has already been created for you and can accessed at <a href="http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/?utm_source=mailpress&utm_medium=email_link&utm_content=__43&utm_campaign=2014-05-04T23:29:51+00:00">http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/</a> with </p>
<ul>
<li>Username: Cfoxcavan</li>
<li>Password: DjJzLoBsYh</li>
</ul>
<p>If you have any problems doing this please contact <a href=mailto:octe-tech@alt.ac.uk target=_blank>octel-tech@alt.ac.uk</a>. </p>
<p>If you wish to join a public email list to discuss the course there are separate <a href=mailto:octel-public@jiscmail.ac.uk target=_blank>instructions for joining octel-public@jiscmail.ac.uk</a>.</p>
<p>Visit <a href="http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/?utm_source=mailpress&utm_medium=email_link&utm_content=__43&utm_campaign=2014-05-04T23:29:51+00:00">http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/</a> for this week’s course material.</p>
<p>We hope you enjoy the course!<br/> <strong>ocTEL team</strong></p> 

 ------------------ end of mail ------------------

 ocTEL 2014
Open Course in Technology Enhanced Learning

* ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ *
! Your New User Account Information on ocTEL 2014 !
* ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ *
May 5, 2014



	Hello – a warm welcome from everyone at ocTEL! 

	We’ve called this Week 0 of the course because it’s a – hopefully – fairly gentle introduction to how the course works, the range of experiences you can expect, and how you can ‘design’ your own path through it to meet your needs. 

	I’m the lead tutor for this week (there are different tutors for each week), and I’m aiming to show you the ropes. I look forward to our exchanges in our various online spaces and in Wednesday’s webinar.    

	So, first, here is a brief summary of things you need to know to get the most of the course and make it work for you. 

	all the best, David Jennings. 

	First things first 

	What we will do: 
	* 

	Each week you will receive an email providing you with an overview of the week ahead. 
	* 

	You will also automatically receive details of the weekly webinar, including the link to join. The link to the recording will be posted online on the same day; 

	​ Accessing the ocTEL Site

	ocTEL aims to accommodate your communication preferences as far as possible and is not limited to the spaces provided in the ocTEL site, so wherever you feel most comfortable writing — as long as it is not behind a password login — we will do our best to collect it up and add it to the general mix. To allow use to collect these contribution please use the #ocTEL tag. You can find out more about how this works in our ocTEL Participants’ Handbook http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/?utm_source=mailpress&utm_medium=email_link&utm_content=__44&utm_campaign=2014-05-04T23:29:53+00:00handbook/ 

	Spaces are provided on the ocTEL website for discussion and for you to connect and share your experiences with other ocTEL participants. The majority of these can be viewed without a password. If you would like to contribute a website account has already been created for you and can accessed at http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/?utm_source=mailpress&utm_medium=email_link&utm_content=__44&utm_campaign=2014-05-04T23:29:53+00:00 [http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/?utm_source=mailpress&utm_medium=email_link&utm_content=__44&utm_campaign=2014-05-04T23:29:53+00:00] with 
	* Username: paulgareth.smith 
	* Password: ElBlYqWlTr 

	If you have any problems doing this please contact octel-tech@alt.ac.uk. 

	If you wish to join a public email list to discuss the course there are separate instructions for joining octel-public@jiscmail.ac.uk. 

	Visit http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/?utm_source=mailpress&utm_medium=email_link&utm_content=__44&utm_campaign=2014-05-04T23:29:53+00:00 [http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/?utm_source=mailpress&utm_medium=email_link&utm_content=__44&utm_campaign=2014-05-04T23:29:53+00:00] for this week’s course material. 

	We hope you enjoy the course!
 OCTEL TEAM

 ------------------- text/html -------------------  
 <p>Hello &#8211; a warm welcome from everyone at ocTEL!</p>
<p>We’ve called this Week 0 of the course because it’s a – hopefully – fairly gentle introduction to how the course works, the range of experiences you can expect, and how you can ‘design’ your own path through it to meet your needs.</p>
<p>I’m the lead tutor for this week (there are different tutors for each week), and I’m aiming to show you the ropes. I look forward to our exchanges in our various online spaces and in Wednesday’s webinar.   </p>
<p>So, first, here is a brief summary of things you need to know to get the most of the course and make it work for you.</p>
<p>all the best, David Jennings.</p>
<p>First things first</p>
<p>What we will do:</p>
<ul>
<li>
<p>Each week you will receive an email providing you with an overview of the week ahead.</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>You will also automatically receive details of the weekly webinar, including the link to join. The link to the recording will be posted online on the same day;</p>
</li>
</ul>
<p>​</p>
<h2>Accessing the ocTEL Site<br />
</h2>
<p>ocTEL aims to accommodate your communication preferences as far as possible and is not limited to the spaces provided in the <a href=http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/ target=_blank>ocTEL site</a>, so wherever you feel most comfortable writing &#8212; as long as it is not behind a password login &#8212; we will do our best to collect it up and add it to the general mix. To allow use to collect these contribution please use the #ocTEL tag. You can find out more about how this works in our <a href=http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/handbook/ target=_blank>ocTEL Participants’ Handbook</a> http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/handbook/</p>
<p>Spaces are provided on the ocTEL website for discussion and for you to connect and share your experiences with other ocTEL participants. The majority of these can be viewed without a password. If you would like to contribute a website account has already been created for you and can accessed at <a href="http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/?utm_source=mailpress&utm_medium=email_link&utm_content=__44&utm_campaign=2014-05-04T23:29:53+00:00">http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/</a> with </p>
<ul>
<li>Username: paulgareth.smith</li>
<li>Password: ElBlYqWlTr</li>
</ul>
<p>If you have any problems doing this please contact <a href=mailto:octe-tech@alt.ac.uk target=_blank>octel-tech@alt.ac.uk</a>. </p>
<p>If you wish to join a public email list to discuss the course there are separate <a href=mailto:octel-public@jiscmail.ac.uk target=_blank>instructions for joining octel-public@jiscmail.ac.uk</a>.</p>
<p>Visit <a href="http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/?utm_source=mailpress&utm_medium=email_link&utm_content=__44&utm_campaign=2014-05-04T23:29:53+00:00">http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/</a> for this week’s course material.</p>
<p>We hope you enjoy the course!<br/> <strong>ocTEL team</strong></p>

 ------------------- text/html -------------------  
 <p>Hello &#8211; a warm welcome from everyone at ocTEL!</p>
<p>We’ve called this Week 0 of the course because it’s a – hopefully – fairly gentle introduction to how the course works, the range of experiences you can expect, and how you can ‘design’ your own path through it to meet your needs.</p>
<p>I’m the lead tutor for this week (there are different tutors for each week), and I’m aiming to show you the ropes. I look forward to our exchanges in our various online spaces and in Wednesday’s webinar.   </p>
<p>So, first, here is a brief summary of things you need to know to get the most of the course and make it work for you.</p>
<p>all the best, David Jennings.</p>
<p>First things first</p>
<p>What we will do:</p>
<ul>
<li>
<p>Each week you will receive an email providing you with an overview of the week ahead.</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>You will also automatically receive details of the weekly webinar, including the link to join. The link to the recording will be posted online on the same day;</p>
</li>
</ul>
<p>​</p>
<h2>Accessing the ocTEL Site<br />
</h2>
<p>ocTEL aims to accommodate your communication preferences as far as possible and is not limited to the spaces provided in the <a href=http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/ target=_blank>ocTEL site</a>, so wherever you feel most comfortable writing &#8212; as long as it is not behind a password login &#8212; we will do our best to collect it up and add it to the general mix. To allow use to collect these contribution please use the #ocTEL tag. You can find out more about how this works in our <a href=http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/handbook/ target=_blank>ocTEL Participants’ Handbook</a> http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/handbook/</p>
<p>Spaces are provided on the ocTEL website for discussion and for you to connect and share your experiences with other ocTEL participants. The majority of these can be viewed without a password. If you would like to contribute a website account has already been created for you and can accessed at <a href="http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/?utm_source=mailpress&utm_medium=email_link&utm_content=__45&utm_campaign=2014-05-04T23:29:55+00:00">http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/</a> with </p>
<ul>
<li>Username: r.graham2</li>
<li>Password: OnWvIcDiGc</li>
</ul>
<p>If you have any problems doing this please contact <a href=mailto:octe-tech@alt.ac.uk target=_blank>octel-tech@alt.ac.uk</a>. </p>
<p>If you wish to join a public email list to discuss the course there are separate <a href=mailto:octel-public@jiscmail.ac.uk target=_blank>instructions for joining octel-public@jiscmail.ac.uk</a>.</p>
<p>Visit <a href="http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/?utm_source=mailpress&utm_medium=email_link&utm_content=__45&utm_campaign=2014-05-04T23:29:55+00:00">http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/</a> for this week’s course material.</p>
<p>We hope you enjoy the course!<br/> <strong>ocTEL team</strong></p>

 From : ocTEL 2014 <octel@alt.ac.uk>

 Subject : Your New User Account Information on ocTEL 2014 
   ------------------- plaintext -------------------  
 ocTEL 2014
Open Course in Technology Enhanced Learning

* ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ *
! Your New User Account Information on ocTEL 2014 !
* ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ *
May 5, 2014



	Hello – a warm welcome from everyone at ocTEL! 

	We’ve called this Week 0 of the course because it’s a – hopefully – fairly gentle introduction to how the course works, the range of experiences you can expect, and how you can ‘design’ your own path through it to meet your needs. 

	I’m the lead tutor for this week (there are different tutors for each week), and I’m aiming to show you the ropes. I look forward to our exchanges in our various online spaces and in Wednesday’s webinar.    

	So, first, here is a brief summary of things you need to know to get the most of the course and make it work for you. 

	all the best, David Jennings. 

	First things first 

	What we will do: 
	* 

	Each week you will receive an email providing you with an overview of the week ahead. 
	* 

	You will also automatically receive details of the weekly webinar, including the link to join. The link to the recording will be posted online on the same day; 

	​ Accessing the ocTEL Site

	ocTEL aims to accommodate your communication preferences as far as possible and is not limited to the spaces provided in the ocTEL site, so wherever you feel most comfortable writing — as long as it is not behind a password login — we will do our best to collect it up and add it to the general mix. To allow use to collect these contribution please use the #ocTEL tag. You can find out more about how this works in our ocTEL Participants’ Handbook http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/?utm_source=mailpress&utm_medium=email_link&utm_content=__46&utm_campaign=2014-05-04T23:29:57+00:00handbook/ 

	Spaces are provided on the ocTEL website for discussion and for you to connect and share your experiences with other ocTEL participants. The majority of these can be viewed without a password. If you would like to contribute a website account has already been created for you and can accessed at http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/?utm_source=mailpress&utm_medium=email_link&utm_content=__46&utm_campaign=2014-05-04T23:29:57+00:00 [http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/?utm_source=mailpress&utm_medium=email_link&utm_content=__46&utm_campaign=2014-05-04T23:29:57+00:00] with 
	* Username: e.butterfield 
	* Password: DxNeKtEqSe 

	If you have any problems doing this please contact octel-tech@alt.ac.uk. 

	If you wish to join a public email list to discuss the course there are separate instructions for joining octel-public@jiscmail.ac.uk. 

	Visit http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/?utm_source=mailpress&utm_medium=email_link&utm_content=__46&utm_campaign=2014-05-04T23:29:57+00:00 [http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/?utm_source=mailpress&utm_medium=email_link&utm_content=__46&utm_campaign=2014-05-04T23:29:57+00:00] for this week’s course material. 

	We hope you enjoy the course!
 OCTEL TEAM 

							this mail is brought to you by MailPress

View [http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/newsletter-subscriptions/?view=b8ab8c59435114b042ec6b765b854334&id=46]
Unsubscribe [http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/newsletter-subscriptions/?del=b8ab8c59435114b042ec6b765b854334] 

 ------------------- text/html -------------------  
 <p>Hello &#8211; a warm welcome from everyone at ocTEL!</p>
<p>We’ve called this Week 0 of the course because it’s a – hopefully – fairly gentle introduction to how the course works, the range of experiences you can expect, and how you can ‘design’ your own path through it to meet your needs.</p>
<p>I’m the lead tutor for this week (there are different tutors for each week), and I’m aiming to show you the ropes. I look forward to our exchanges in our various online spaces and in Wednesday’s webinar.   </p>
<p>So, first, here is a brief summary of things you need to know to get the most of the course and make it work for you.</p>
<p>all the best, David Jennings.</p>
<p>First things first</p>
<p>What we will do:</p>
<ul>
<li>
<p>Each week you will receive an email providing you with an overview of the week ahead.</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>You will also automatically receive details of the weekly webinar, including the link to join. The link to the recording will be posted online on the same day;</p>
</li>
</ul>
<p>​</p>
<h2>Accessing the ocTEL Site<br />
</h2>
<p>ocTEL aims to accommodate your communication preferences as far as possible and is not limited to the spaces provided in the <a href=http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/ target=_blank>ocTEL site</a>, so wherever you feel most comfortable writing &#8212; as long as it is not behind a password login &#8212; we will do our best to collect it up and add it to the general mix. To allow use to collect these contribution please use the #ocTEL tag. You can find out more about how this works in our <a href=http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/handbook/ target=_blank>ocTEL Participants’ Handbook</a> http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/handbook/</p>
<p>Spaces are provided on the ocTEL website for discussion and for you to connect and share your experiences with other ocTEL participants. The majority of these can be viewed without a password. If you would like to contribute a website account has already been created for you and can accessed at <a href="http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/?utm_source=mailpress&utm_medium=email_link&utm_content=__46&utm_campaign=2014-05-04T23:29:57+00:00">http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/</a> with </p>
<ul>
<li>Username: e.butterfield</li>
<li>Password: DxNeKtEqSe</li>
</ul>
<p>If you have any problems doing this please contact <a href=mailto:octe-tech@alt.ac.uk target=_blank>octel-tech@alt.ac.uk</a>. </p>
<p>If you wish to join a public email list to discuss the course there are separate <a href=mailto:octel-public@jiscmail.ac.uk target=_blank>instructions for joining octel-public@jiscmail.ac.uk</a>.</p>
<p>Visit <a href="http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/?utm_source=mailpress&utm_medium=email_link&utm_content=__46&utm_campaign=2014-05-04T23:29:57+00:00">http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/</a> for this week’s course material.</p>
<p>We hope you enjoy the course!<br/> <strong>ocTEL team</strong></p>

You can find out more about how this works in our ocTEL Participants’ Handbook http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/?utm_source=mailpress&utm_medium=email_link&utm_content=__48&utm_campaign=2014-05-04T23:30:03+00:00handbook/

	* Username: nsb_unil

 ------------------- text/html -------------------  
 <p>Hello &#8211; a warm welcome from everyone at ocTEL!</p>
<p>We’ve called this Week 0 of the course because it’s a – hopefully – fairly gentle introduction to how the course works, the range of experiences you can expect, and how you can ‘design’ your own path through it to meet your needs.</p>
<p>I’m the lead tutor for this week (there are different tutors for each week), and I’m aiming to show you the ropes. I look forward to our exchanges in our various online spaces and in Wednesday’s webinar.   </p>
<p>So, first, here is a brief summary of things you need to know to get the most of the course and make it work for you.</p>
<p>all the best, David Jennings.</p>
<p>First things first</p>
<p>What we will do:</p>
<ul>
<li>
<p>Each week you will receive an email providing you with an overview of the week ahead.</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>You will also automatically receive details of the weekly webinar, including the link to join. The link to the recording will be posted online on the same day;</p>
</li>
</ul>
<p>​</p>
<h2>Accessing the ocTEL Site<br />
</h2>
<p>ocTEL aims to accommodate your communication preferences as far as possible and is not limited to the spaces provided in the <a href=http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/ target=_blank>ocTEL site</a>, so wherever you feel most comfortable writing &#8212; as long as it is not behind a password login &#8212; we will do our best to collect it up and add it to the general mix. To allow use to collect these contribution please use the #ocTEL tag. You can find out more about how this works in our <a href=http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/handbook/ target=_blank>ocTEL Participants’ Handbook</a> http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/handbook/</p>
<p>Spaces are provided on the ocTEL website for discussion and for you to connect and share your experiences with other ocTEL participants. The majority of these can be viewed without a password. If you would like to contribute a website account has already been created for you and can accessed at <a href="http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/?utm_source=mailpress&utm_medium=email_link&utm_content=__48&utm_campaign=2014-05-04T23:30:03+00:00">http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/</a> with </p>
<ul>
<li>Username: nsb_unil</li>
<li>Password: CzWpDmAoCr</li>
</ul>
<p>If you have any problems doing this please contact <a href=mailto:octe-tech@alt.ac.uk target=_blank>octel-tech@alt.ac.uk</a>. </p>
<p>If you wish to join a public email list to discuss the course there are separate <a href=mailto:octel-public@jiscmail.ac.uk target=_blank>instructions for joining octel-public@jiscmail.ac.uk</a>.</p>
<p>Visit <a href="http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/?utm_source=mailpress&utm_medium=email_link&utm_content=__48&utm_campaign=2014-05-04T23:30:03+00:00">http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/</a> for this week’s course material.</p>
<p>We hope you enjoy the course!<br/> <strong>ocTEL team</strong></p> 

 ------------------ end of mail ------------------

 ocTEL 2014
Open Course in Technology Enhanced Learning

* ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ *
! Your New User Account Information on ocTEL 2014 !
* ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ *
May 5, 2014



	Hello – a warm welcome from everyone at ocTEL! 

	We’ve called this Week 0 of the course because it’s a – hopefully – fairly gentle introduction to how the course works, the range of experiences you can expect, and how you can ‘design’ your own path through it to meet your needs. 

	I’m the lead tutor for this week (there are different tutors for each week), and I’m aiming to show you the ropes. I look forward to our exchanges in our various online spaces and in Wednesday’s webinar.    

	So, first, here is a brief summary of things you need to know to get the most of the course and make it work for you. 

	all the best, David Jennings. 

	First things first 

	What we will do: 
	* 

	Each week you will receive an email providing you with an overview of the week ahead. 
	* 

	You will also automatically receive details of the weekly webinar, including the link to join. The link to the recording will be posted online on the same day; 

	​ Accessing the ocTEL Site

	ocTEL aims to accommodate your communication preferences as far as possible and is not limited to the spaces provided in the ocTEL site, so wherever you feel most comfortable writing — as long as it is not behind a password login — we will do our best to collect it up and add it to the general mix. To allow use to collect these contribution please use the #ocTEL tag. You can find out more about how this works in our ocTEL Participants’ Handbook http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/?utm_source=mailpress&utm_medium=email_link&utm_content=__49&utm_campaign=2014-05-04T23:30:07+00:00handbook/ 

	Spaces are provided on the ocTEL website for discussion and for you to connect and share your experiences with other ocTEL participants. The majority of these can be viewed without a password. If you would like to contribute a website account has already been created for you and can accessed at http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/?utm_source=mailpress&utm_medium=email_link&utm_content=__49&utm_campaign=2014-05-04T23:30:07+00:00 [http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/?utm_source=mailpress&utm_medium=email_link&utm_content=__49&utm_campaign=2014-05-04T23:30:07+00:00] with 
	* Username: claire.englund 
	* Password: TqUjGzCzFb 

	If you have any problems doing this please contact octel-tech@alt.ac.uk. 

	If you wish to join a public email list to discuss the course there are separate instructions for joining octel-public@jiscmail.ac.uk. 

	Visit http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/?utm_source=mailpress&utm_medium=email_link&utm_content=__49&utm_campaign=2014-05-04T23:30:07+00:00 [http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/?utm_source=mailpress&utm_medium=email_link&utm_content=__49&utm_campaign=2014-05-04T23:30:07+00:00] for this week’s course material. 

	We hope you enjoy the course!

 <p>Hello &#8211; a warm welcome from everyone at ocTEL!</p>
<p>We’ve called this Week 0 of the course because it’s a – hopefully – fairly gentle introduction to how the course works, the range of experiences you can expect, and how you can ‘design’ your own path through it to meet your needs.</p>
<p>I’m the lead tutor for this week (there are different tutors for each week), and I’m aiming to show you the ropes. I look forward to our exchanges in our various online spaces and in Wednesday’s webinar.   </p>
<p>So, first, here is a brief summary of things you need to know to get the most of the course and make it work for you.</p>
<p>all the best, David Jennings.</p>

</li>
<li>

 ------------------- start of mail -------------------   
 From : ocTEL 2014 <octel@alt.ac.uk>  
 To   : j e henderson <j.e.henderson@leeds.ac.uk>  
 Subject : Your New User Account Information on ocTEL 2014 
   ------------------- plaintext -------------------  
 ocTEL 2014
Open Course in Technology Enhanced Learning

* ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ *
! Your New User Account Information on ocTEL 2014 !
* ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ *
May 5, 2014



	Hello – a warm welcome from everyone at ocTEL! 

	We’ve called this Week 0 of the course because it’s a – hopefully – fairly gentle introduction to how the course works, the range of experiences you can expect, and how you can ‘design’ your own path through it to meet your needs. 

	I’m the lead tutor for this week (there are different tutors for each week), and I’m aiming to show you the ropes. I look forward to our exchanges in our various online spaces and in Wednesday’s webinar.    

	So, first, here is a brief summary of things you need to know to get the most of the course and make it work for you. 

	all the best, David Jennings. 

	First things first 

	What we will do: 
	* 

	Each week you will receive an email providing you with an overview of the week ahead. 
	* 

	You will also automatically receive details of the weekly webinar, including the link to join. The link to the recording will be posted online on the same day; 

	​ Accessing the ocTEL Site

	ocTEL aims to accommodate your communication preferences as far as possible and is not limited to the spaces provided in the ocTEL site, so wherever you feel most comfortable writing — as long as it is not behind a password login — we will do our best to collect it up and add it to the general mix. To allow use to collect these contribution please use the #ocTEL tag. You can find out more about how this works in our ocTEL Participants’ Handbook http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/?utm_source=mailpress&utm_medium=email_link&utm_content=__51&utm_campaign=2014-05-04T23:30:15+00:00handbook/ 

	Spaces are provided on the ocTEL website for discussion and for you to connect and share your experiences with other ocTEL participants. The majority of these can be viewed without a password. If you would like to contribute a website account has already been created for you and can accessed at http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/?utm_source=mailpress&utm_medium=email_link&utm_content=__51&utm_campaign=2014-05-04T23:30:15+00:00 [http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/?utm_source=mailpress&utm_medium=email_link&utm_content=__51&utm_campaign=2014-05-04T23:30:15+00:00] with 
	* Username: JessCareers 
	* Password: RhClRaIyYp 

	If you have any problems doing this please contact octel-tech@alt.ac.uk. 

	If you wish to join a public email list to discuss the course there are separate instructions for joining octel-public@jiscmail.ac.uk. 

	Visit http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/?utm_source=mailpress&utm_medium=email_link&utm_content=__51&utm_campaign=2014-05-04T23:30:15+00:00 [http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/?utm_source=mailpress&utm_medium=email_link&utm_content=__51&utm_campaign=2014-05-04T23:30:15+00:00] for this week’s course material. 

	We hope you enjoy the course!
 OCTEL TEAM 

							this mail is brought to you by MailPress

View [http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/newsletter-subscriptions/?view=d716d6434a522844cf59f7ece22e1ae4&id=51]
Unsubscribe [http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/newsletter-subscriptions/?del=d716d6434a522844cf59f7ece22e1ae4] 

 ------------------- text/html -------------------  
 <p>Hello &#8211; a warm welcome from everyone at ocTEL!</p>
<p>We’ve called this Week 0 of the course because it’s a – hopefully – fairly gentle introduction to how the course works, the range of experiences you can expect, and how you can ‘design’ your own path through it to meet your needs.</p>
<p>I’m the lead tutor for this week (there are different tutors for each week), and I’m aiming to show you the ropes. I look forward to our exchanges in our various online spaces and in Wednesday’s webinar.   </p>
<p>So, first, here is a brief summary of things you need to know to get the most of the course and make it work for you.</p>
<p>all the best, David Jennings.</p>
<p>First things first</p>
<p>What we will do:</p>
<ul>
<li>
<p>Each week you will receive an email providing you with an overview of the week ahead.</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>You will also automatically receive details of the weekly webinar, including the link to join. The link to the recording will be posted online on the same day;</p>
</li>
</ul>
<p>​</p>
<h2>Accessing the ocTEL Site<br />
</h2>
<p>ocTEL aims to accommodate your communication preferences as far as possible and is not limited to the spaces provided in the <a href=http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/ target=_blank>ocTEL site</a>, so wherever you feel most comfortable writing &#8212; as long as it is not behind a password login &#8212; we will do our best to collect it up and add it to the general mix. To allow use to collect these contribution please use the #ocTEL tag. You can find out more about how this works in our <a href=http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/handbook/ target=_blank>ocTEL Participants’ Handbook</a> http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/handbook/</p>
<p>Spaces are provided on the ocTEL website for discussion and for you to connect and share your experiences with other ocTEL participants. The majority of these can be viewed without a password. If you would like to contribute a website account has already been created for you and can accessed at <a href="http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/?utm_source=mailpress&utm_medium=email_link&utm_content=__51&utm_campaign=2014-05-04T23:30:15+00:00">http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/</a> with </p>
<ul>
<li>Username: JessCareers</li>
<li>Password: RhClRaIyYp</li>
</ul>
<p>If you have any problems doing this please contact <a href=mailto:octe-tech@alt.ac.uk target=_blank>octel-tech@alt.ac.uk</a>. </p>
<p>If you wish to join a public email list to discuss the course there are separate <a href=mailto:octel-public@jiscmail.ac.uk target=_blank>instructions for joining octel-public@jiscmail.ac.uk</a>.</p>
<p>Visit <a href="http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/?utm_source=mailpress&utm_medium=email_link&utm_content=__51&utm_campaign=2014-05-04T23:30:15+00:00">http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/</a> for this week’s course material.</p>
<p>We hope you enjoy the course!<br/> <strong>ocTEL team</strong></p> 

 ------------------ end of mail ------------------

	Visit http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/?utm_source=mailpress&utm_medium=email_link&utm_content=__53&utm_campaign=2014-05-04T23:30:24+00:00 [http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/?utm_source=mailpress&utm_medium=email_link&utm_content=__53&utm_campaign=2014-05-04T23:30:24+00:00] for this week’s course material.

 ------------------- text/html -------------------  
 <p>Hello &#8211; a warm welcome from everyone at ocTEL!</p>
<p>We’ve called this Week 0 of the course because it’s a – hopefully – fairly gentle introduction to how the course works, the range of experiences you can expect, and how you can ‘design’ your own path through it to meet your needs.</p>
<p>I’m the lead tutor for this week (there are different tutors for each week), and I’m aiming to show you the ropes. I look forward to our exchanges in our various online spaces and in Wednesday’s webinar.   </p>
<p>So, first, here is a brief summary of things you need to know to get the most of the course and make it work for you.</p>
<p>all the best, David Jennings.</p>
<p>First things first</p>
<p>What we will do:</p>
<ul>
<li>
<p>Each week you will receive an email providing you with an overview of the week ahead.</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>You will also automatically receive details of the weekly webinar, including the link to join. The link to the recording will be posted online on the same day;</p>
</li>
</ul>
<p>​</p>
<h2>Accessing the ocTEL Site<br />
</h2>
<p>ocTEL aims to accommodate your communication preferences as far as possible and is not limited to the spaces provided in the <a href=http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/ target=_blank>ocTEL site</a>, so wherever you feel most comfortable writing &#8212; as long as it is not behind a password login &#8212; we will do our best to collect it up and add it to the general mix. To allow use to collect these contribution please use the #ocTEL tag. You can find out more about how this works in our <a href=http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/handbook/ target=_blank>ocTEL Participants’ Handbook</a> http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/handbook/</p>
<p>Spaces are provided on the ocTEL website for discussion and for you to connect and share your experiences with other ocTEL participants. The majority of these can be viewed without a password. If you would like to contribute a website account has already been created for you and can accessed at <a href="http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/?utm_source=mailpress&utm_medium=email_link&utm_content=__53&utm_campaign=2014-05-04T23:30:24+00:00">http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/</a> with </p>
<ul>
<li>Username: irenasthr</li>
<li>Password: WxImLhBzGv</li>
</ul>
<p>If you have any problems doing this please contact <a href=mailto:octe-tech@alt.ac.uk target=_blank>octel-tech@alt.ac.uk</a>. </p>
<p>If you wish to join a public email list to discuss the course there are separate <a href=mailto:octel-public@jiscmail.ac.uk target=_blank>instructions for joining octel-public@jiscmail.ac.uk</a>.</p>
<p>Visit <a href="http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/?utm_source=mailpress&utm_medium=email_link&utm_content=__53&utm_campaign=2014-05-04T23:30:24+00:00">http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/</a> for this week’s course material.</p>
<p>We hope you enjoy the course!<br/> <strong>ocTEL team</strong></p>

	Hello – a warm welcome from everyone at ocTEL! 

	We’ve called this Week 0 of the course because it’s a – hopefully – fairly gentle introduction to how the course works, the range of experiences you can expect, and how you can ‘design’ your own path through it to meet your needs. 

	I’m the lead tutor for this week (there are different tutors for each week), and I’m aiming to show you the ropes. I look forward to our exchanges in our various online spaces and in Wednesday’s webinar.

	all the best, David Jennings.

	*

	*

 ------------------- start of mail -------------------   
 From : ocTEL 2014 <octel@alt.ac.uk>  
 To   : rhalpin <rhalpin@yorkcollege.ac.uk>  
 Subject : Your New User Account Information on ocTEL 2014 
   ------------------- plaintext -------------------  
 ocTEL 2014
Open Course in Technology Enhanced Learning

* ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ *
! Your New User Account Information on ocTEL 2014 !
* ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ *
May 5, 2014



	Hello – a warm welcome from everyone at ocTEL! 

	We’ve called this Week 0 of the course because it’s a – hopefully – fairly gentle introduction to how the course works, the range of experiences you can expect, and how you can ‘design’ your own path through it to meet your needs. 

	I’m the lead tutor for this week (there are different tutors for each week), and I’m aiming to show you the ropes. I look forward to our exchanges in our various online spaces and in Wednesday’s webinar.    

	So, first, here is a brief summary of things you need to know to get the most of the course and make it work for you. 

	all the best, David Jennings. 

	First things first 

	What we will do: 
	* 

	Each week you will receive an email providing you with an overview of the week ahead. 
	* 

	You will also automatically receive details of the weekly webinar, including the link to join. The link to the recording will be posted online on the same day; 

	​ Accessing the ocTEL Site

	ocTEL aims to accommodate your communication preferences as far as possible and is not limited to the spaces provided in the ocTEL site, so wherever you feel most comfortable writing — as long as it is not behind a password login — we will do our best to collect it up and add it to the general mix. To allow use to collect these contribution please use the #ocTEL tag. You can find out more about how this works in our ocTEL Participants’ Handbook http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/?utm_source=mailpress&utm_medium=email_link&utm_content=__56&utm_campaign=2014-05-04T23:30:31+00:00handbook/ 

	Spaces are provided on the ocTEL website for discussion and for you to connect and share your experiences with other ocTEL participants. The majority of these can be viewed without a password. If you would like to contribute a website account has already been created for you and can accessed at http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/?utm_source=mailpress&utm_medium=email_link&utm_content=__56&utm_campaign=2014-05-04T23:30:31+00:00 [http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/?utm_source=mailpress&utm_medium=email_link&utm_content=__56&utm_campaign=2014-05-04T23:30:31+00:00] with 
	* Username: royhalpin 
	* Password: FdSxZcUzYg 

	If you have any problems doing this please contact octel-tech@alt.ac.uk. 

	If you wish to join a public email list to discuss the course there are separate instructions for joining octel-public@jiscmail.ac.uk. 

	Visit http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/?utm_source=mailpress&utm_medium=email_link&utm_content=__56&utm_campaign=2014-05-04T23:30:31+00:00 [http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/?utm_source=mailpress&utm_medium=email_link&utm_content=__56&utm_campaign=2014-05-04T23:30:31+00:00] for this week’s course material. 

	We hope you enjoy the course!
 OCTEL TEAM 

							this mail is brought to you by MailPress

View [http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/newsletter-subscriptions/?view=db61fb1136fd915b40b6f673e2218fe2&id=56]
Unsubscribe [http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/newsletter-subscriptions/?del=db61fb1136fd915b40b6f673e2218fe2] 

 ------------------- text/html -------------------  
 <p>Hello &#8211; a warm welcome from everyone at ocTEL!</p>
<p>We’ve called this Week 0 of the course because it’s a – hopefully – fairly gentle introduction to how the course works, the range of experiences you can expect, and how you can ‘design’ your own path through it to meet your needs.</p>
<p>I’m the lead tutor for this week (there are different tutors for each week), and I’m aiming to show you the ropes. I look forward to our exchanges in our various online spaces and in Wednesday’s webinar.   </p>
<p>So, first, here is a brief summary of things you need to know to get the most of the course and make it work for you.</p>
<p>all the best, David Jennings.</p>
<p>First things first</p>
<p>What we will do:</p>
<ul>
<li>
<p>Each week you will receive an email providing you with an overview of the week ahead.</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>You will also automatically receive details of the weekly webinar, including the link to join. The link to the recording will be posted online on the same day;</p>
</li>
</ul>
<p>​</p>
<h2>Accessing the ocTEL Site<br />
</h2>
<p>ocTEL aims to accommodate your communication preferences as far as possible and is not limited to the spaces provided in the <a href=http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/ target=_blank>ocTEL site</a>, so wherever you feel most comfortable writing &#8212; as long as it is not behind a password login &#8212; we will do our best to collect it up and add it to the general mix. To allow use to collect these contribution please use the #ocTEL tag. You can find out more about how this works in our <a href=http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/handbook/ target=_blank>ocTEL Participants’ Handbook</a> http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/handbook/</p>
<p>Spaces are provided on the ocTEL website for discussion and for you to connect and share your experiences with other ocTEL participants. The majority of these can be viewed without a password. If you would like to contribute a website account has already been created for you and can accessed at <a href="http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/?utm_source=mailpress&utm_medium=email_link&utm_content=__56&utm_campaign=2014-05-04T23:30:31+00:00">http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/</a> with </p>
<ul>
<li>Username: royhalpin</li>
<li>Password: FdSxZcUzYg</li>
</ul>
<p>If you have any problems doing this please contact <a href=mailto:octe-tech@alt.ac.uk target=_blank>octel-tech@alt.ac.uk</a>. </p>
<p>If you wish to join a public email list to discuss the course there are separate <a href=mailto:octel-public@jiscmail.ac.uk target=_blank>instructions for joining octel-public@jiscmail.ac.uk</a>.</p>
<p>Visit <a href="http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/?utm_source=mailpress&utm_medium=email_link&utm_content=__56&utm_campaign=2014-05-04T23:30:31+00:00">http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/</a> for this week’s course material.</p>
<p>We hope you enjoy the course!<br/> <strong>ocTEL team</strong></p> 

 ------------------ end of mail ------------------

 ocTEL 2014
Open Course in Technology Enhanced Learning

* ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ *
! Your New User Account Information on ocTEL 2014 !

May 5, 2014



	Hello – a warm welcome from everyone at ocTEL! 

	We’ve called this Week 0 of the course because it’s a – hopefully – fairly gentle introduction to how the course works, the range of experiences you can expect, and how you can ‘design’ your own path through it to meet your needs. 

	I’m the lead tutor for this week (there are different tutors for each week), and I’m aiming to show you the ropes. I look forward to our exchanges in our various online spaces and in Wednesday’s webinar.    

	So, first, here is a brief summary of things you need to know to get the most of the course and make it work for you. 

	all the best, David Jennings. 

	First things first 

	What we will do: 
	* 

	Each week you will receive an email providing you with an overview of the week ahead. 
	* 

	You will also automatically receive details of the weekly webinar, including the link to join. The link to the recording will be posted online on the same day; 

	​ Accessing the ocTEL Site

	ocTEL aims to accommodate your communication preferences as far as possible and is not limited to the spaces provided in the ocTEL site, so wherever you feel most comfortable writing — as long as it is not behind a password login — we will do our best to collect it up and add it to the general mix. 	* Password: NdXeEdQsRz

 <p>Hello &#8211; a warm welcome from everyone at ocTEL!</p>
<p>We’ve called this Week 0 of the course because it’s a – hopefully – fairly gentle introduction to how the course works, the range of experiences you can expect, and how you can ‘design’ your own path through it to meet your needs.</p>
<p>I’m the lead tutor for this week (there are different tutors for each week), and I’m aiming to show you the ropes. I look forward to our exchanges in our various online spaces and in Wednesday’s webinar.   </p>
<p>So, first, here is a brief summary of things you need to know to get the most of the course and make it work for you.</p>
<p>all the best, David Jennings.</p>
<p>First things first</p>
<p>What we will do:</p>
<ul>
<li>
<p>Each week you will receive an email providing you with an overview of the week ahead.</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>You will also automatically receive details of the weekly webinar, including the link to join. The link to the recording will be posted online on the same day;</p>
</li>
</ul>
<p>​</p>
<h2>Accessing the ocTEL Site<br />
</h2>
<p>ocTEL aims to accommodate your communication preferences as far as possible and is not limited to the spaces provided in the <a href=http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/ target=_blank>ocTEL site</a>, so wherever you feel most comfortable writing &#8212; as long as it is not behind a password login &#8212; we will do our best to collect it up and add it to the general mix. To allow use to collect these contribution please use the #ocTEL tag. You can find out more about how this works in our <a href=http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/handbook/ target=_blank>ocTEL Participants’ Handbook</a> http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/handbook/</p>
<p>Spaces are provided on the ocTEL website for discussion and for you to connect and share your experiences with other ocTEL participants. The majority of these can be viewed without a password. If you would like to contribute a website account has already been created for you and can accessed at <a href="http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/?utm_source=mailpress&utm_medium=email_link&utm_content=__57&utm_campaign=2014-05-04T23:30:34+00:00">http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/</a> with </p>
<ul>
<li>Username: irene.bailey</li>
<li>Password: NdXeEdQsRz</li>
</ul>
<p>If you have any problems doing this please contact <a href=mailto:octe-tech@alt.ac.uk target=_blank>octel-tech@alt.ac.uk</a>. </p>
<p>If you wish to join a public email list to discuss the course there are separate <a href=mailto:octel-public@jiscmail.ac.uk target=_blank>instructions for joining octel-public@jiscmail.ac.uk</a>.</p>

<p>We hope you enjoy the course!<br/> <strong>ocTEL team</strong></p>

 ------------------- text/html -------------------  
 <p>Hello &#8211; a warm welcome from everyone at ocTEL!</p>
<p>We’ve called this Week 0 of the course because it’s a – hopefully – fairly gentle introduction to how the course works, the range of experiences you can expect, and how you can ‘design’ your own path through it to meet your needs.</p>
<p>I’m the lead tutor for this week (there are different tutors for each week), and I’m aiming to show you the ropes. I look forward to our exchanges in our various online spaces and in Wednesday’s webinar.   </p>
<p>So, first, here is a brief summary of things you need to know to get the most of the course and make it work for you.</p>
<p>all the best, David Jennings.</p>
<p>First things first</p>
<p>What we will do:</p>
<ul>
<li>
<p>Each week you will receive an email providing you with an overview of the week ahead.</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>You will also automatically receive details of the weekly webinar, including the link to join. The link to the recording will be posted online on the same day;</p>
</li>
</ul>
<p>​</p>
<h2>Accessing the ocTEL Site<br />
</h2>
<p>ocTEL aims to accommodate your communication preferences as far as possible and is not limited to the spaces provided in the <a href=http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/ target=_blank>ocTEL site</a>, so wherever you feel most comfortable writing &#8212; as long as it is not behind a password login &#8212; we will do our best to collect it up and add it to the general mix. To allow use to collect these contribution please use the #ocTEL tag. You can find out more about how this works in our <a href=http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/handbook/ target=_blank>ocTEL Participants’ Handbook</a> http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/handbook/</p>
<p>Spaces are provided on the ocTEL website for discussion and for you to connect and share your experiences with other ocTEL participants. The majority of these can be viewed without a password. If you would like to contribute a website account has already been created for you and can accessed at <a href="http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/?utm_source=mailpress&utm_medium=email_link&utm_content=__58&utm_campaign=2014-05-04T23:30:37+00:00">http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/</a> with </p>
<ul>
<li>Username: aiqbal</li>
<li>Password: DhBcHoWwOk</li>
</ul>
<p>If you have any problems doing this please contact <a href=mailto:octe-tech@alt.ac.uk target=_blank>octel-tech@alt.ac.uk</a>. </p>
<p>If you wish to join a public email list to discuss the course there are separate <a href=mailto:octel-public@jiscmail.ac.uk target=_blank>instructions for joining octel-public@jiscmail.ac.uk</a>.</p>
<p>Visit <a href="http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/?utm_source=mailpress&utm_medium=email_link&utm_content=__58&utm_campaign=2014-05-04T23:30:37+00:00">http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/</a> for this week’s course material.</p>
<p>We hope you enjoy the course!<br/> <strong>ocTEL team</strong></p> 

 ------------------ end of mail ------------------

 From : ocTEL Newsletter <octel@alt.ac.uk>  
 To   : g r saward <g.r.saward@herts.ac.uk>  
 Subject : [ocTEL 2014] New message from c.collis 
   ------------------- plaintext -------------------  
 ocTEL 2014
Open Course in Technology Enhanced Learning

* ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ *
! [ocTEL 2014] New message from c.collis !
* ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ *
May 5, 2014



	c.collis sent you a new message: 

	Subject: Re: Exploring the platform 

	“Hi Guy:
Good line of thought. I’m participating in ocTEL somewhat anonymously because I feel that it gives me freedom to be a learner, and to possibly discuss my own institution and institutional practices without having to filter. I’m head of a large academic department, which means I have to be reasonably circumspect in my professional life; participating in the MOOC as me the learner instead of me the Head allows me to be more open and more amateur. 

	Two stories behind my photo: one, system upgrade at work recently resulted in my whole ‘photos’ folder being deleted, complete with all my standard profesisonal headshots. Two, the week I joined ocTEL I completed my first open-ocean long-distance swim, and while sitting here thinking about diigo vs storify vs scoopit I’m also looking out the window, remembering the sea. 

	Cheers
c” 

	To view and read your messages please log in and visit: http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/members/guysaward/messages/ 

	———————
To disable these notifications please log in and go to: http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/members/guysaward/settings/notifications/ 

							this mail is brought to you by MailPress

 ocTEL 2014
Open Course in Technology Enhanced Learning

* ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ *
! Nell C Rundle posted a new activity comment in the group Enthusing staff to engage with TEL [ocTEL 2014] !
* ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ *
May 5, 2014



	Nell C Rundle posted a new activity comment in the group Enthusing staff to engage with TEL 

	“What is your approach to collecting case studies? I have a sense that this approach to sharing practice is likely to be quite powerful in showcasing options and possibilities, but at my institution we have not really done well in collecting them in a coherent way, or sharing them on. I’d be very interested to know what approaches others have taken/take to first finding and ‘collecting’ case studies, and secondly in sharing them effectively with a wider audience.” 

	To view or reply, log in and go to: 

	http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/groups/enthusing-staff-to-engage-with-tel/ 

	———————
Your email setting for this group is: All Email

	To disable all notifications for this group, click: http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/members/citizendavis/?bpass-action=unsubscribe&group=20&access_key=e65f2d52414374b689ece541d095c04a

 <p>Nell C Rundle posted a new activity comment in the group Enthusing staff to engage with TEL</p>
<p>&#8220;What is your approach to collecting case studies? I have a sense that this approach to sharing practice is likely to be quite powerful in showcasing options and possibilities, but at my institution we have not really done well in collecting them in a coherent way, or sharing them on.  I&#8217;d be very interested to know what approaches others have taken/take to first finding and &#8216;collecting&#8217; case studies, and secondly in sharing them effectively with a wider audience.&#8221;</p>

 ocTEL 2014
Open Course in Technology Enhanced Learning

* ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ *
! [ocTEL 2014] Nell C Rundle replied to one of your updates !
* ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ *
May 5, 2014



	Nell C Rundle replied to one of your updates: 

	“What is your approach to collecting case studies? I have a sense that this approach to sharing practice is likely to be quite powerful in showcasing options and possibilities, but at my institution we have not really done well in collecting them in a coherent way, or sharing them on. I’d be very interested to know what approaches others have taken/take to first finding and ‘collecting’ case studies, and secondly in sharing them effectively with a wider audience.” 

	To view your original update and all comments, log in and visit: http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/activity/p/3676/ 

	———————
To disable these notifications please log in and go to: http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/members/helenwhd/settings/notifications/

	After a week of “trying to get there” yes something called life keeps moving itself up the priority list

<p>After a week of &#8220;trying to get there&#8221; yes something called life keeps moving itself up the priority list <img src="http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/wp-includes/images/smilies/icon_smile.gif" alt=":)" class="wp-smiley" /><br />

Perhaps I give myself permission to be totally unlike the rest of my ordered existence!</p>

 ocTEL 2014
Open Course in Technology Enhanced Learning

* ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ *
! markofmarks posted an update in the group Higher education (general) [ocTEL 2014] !
* ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ *
May 5, 2014



	markofmarks posted an update in the group Higher education (general) 

	“I’m from Melbourne at Swinburne Uni, where we are expanding in the online space for L&T.
My background is an academic teaching in physiology and neuroscience, and I think that there are great opportunities and challenges for my students. Additionally the microcosm of the people joining and participating in this MOOC reflect some of the realities of my (and probably others’) experience in this realm.
Can we use what we experience here to improve our own practice? Yes. 

	From Alicia’s post, and having just participated in another MOOC a few weeks back, already I am impressed with the ease of group creation/joining/participation in this offering.” 

	To view or reply, log in and go to: 

	http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/groups/higher-education-general/ 

	———————

 <p>markofmarks posted an update in the group Higher education (general)</p>
<p>&#8220;I&#8217;m from Melbourne at Swinburne Uni, where we are expanding in the online space for L&#038;T.<br />
My background is an academic teaching in physiology and neuroscience, and I think that there are great opportunities and challenges for my students. Additionally the microcosm of the people joining and participating in this MOOC reflect some of the realities of my (and probably others&#8217;) experience in this realm.<br />
Can we use what we experience here to improve our own practice? Yes.</p>

 ------------------- start of mail -------------------   
 From : ocTEL Newsletter <octel@alt.ac.uk>  
 To   : vearg <vearg@manchesterfire.gov.uk>  
 Subject : c.collis posted a new activity comment in the group Paul is looking for participants: Activity 0.2: Small group reflection [ocTEL 2014] 
   ------------------- plaintext -------------------  
 ocTEL 2014
Open Course in Technology Enhanced Learning

* ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ *
! c.collis posted a new activity comment in the group Paul is looking for participants: Activity 0.2: Small group reflection [ocTEL 2014] !
* ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ *
May 5, 2014



	c.collis posted a new activity comment in the group Paul is looking for participants: Activity 0.2: Small group reflection 

	“Hi Grant: I’m also particularly looking forward to hearing and learning from teachers about their TEL experiences. I’m benefiting from the participation of many ‘technologists’ here because this is their world and they have a wealth of resources and references to share. In practice, I find that sometimes technologists and teachers work at cross purposes: technologists are rightly more focussed on the tech and all the things it can do and how great it would be if we implemented it in our teaching; teachers are more focussed on the subject content and how it can be taught effectively, whether this involves TEL or not. Teachers sometimes feel beseiged by what they perceive as overzealous technologists bombarding them with things they need to add to their already full courses; technologists sometimes feel frustrated at what they perceive as stubborn academics who refuse to try new things that the technologists know could enhance their students’ learning experiences. I can see the frustrations of both groups (and I know the lines between these two groups are nowhere near as clear-cut as this post indicates). It wil be interesting to see how these two groups interact in this MOOC, or whetehr they are in fact identifiable as two groups in this environment. I’m learning from both. “ 

	To view or reply, log in and go to: 

	http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/groups/paul-is-looking-for-participants-activity-0-2-small-group-reflection/ 

	———————
Your email setting for this group is: All Email
To change your email setting for this group, please log in and go to: http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/wp-login.php?action=bpnoaccess&auth=1&redirect_to=http%3A%2F%2Foctel.alt.ac.uk%2F2014%2Fgroups%2Fpaul-is-looking-for-participants-activity-0-2-small-group-reflection%2Fnotifications%2F 

	To disable all notifications for this group, click: http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/members/vearg/?bpass-action=unsubscribe&group=2&access_key=0df36c711d1b8cd569a10427e82d2a8d 

							this mail is brought to you by MailPress

View [http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/newsletter-subscriptions/?view=b7b37477c02e3f5a1a960ee1040dd99e&id=70]
Unsubscribe [http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/newsletter-subscriptions/?del=b7b37477c02e3f5a1a960ee1040dd99e] 

 ------------------- text/html -------------------  
 <p>c.collis posted a new activity comment in the group Paul is looking for participants: Activity 0.2: Small group reflection</p>
<p>&#8220;Hi Grant: I&#8217;m also particularly looking forward to hearing and learning from teachers about their TEL experiences. I&#8217;m benefiting from the participation of many &#8216;technologists&#8217; here  because this is their world and they have a wealth of resources and references to share. In practice, I find that sometimes technologists and teachers work at cross purposes: technologists are rightly more focussed on the tech and all the things it can do and how great it would be if we implemented it in our teaching; teachers are more focussed on the subject content and how it can be taught effectively, whether this involves TEL or not. Teachers sometimes feel beseiged by what they perceive as overzealous technologists bombarding them with things they need to add to their already full courses; technologists sometimes feel frustrated at what they perceive as stubborn academics who refuse to try new things that the technologists know could enhance their students&#8217; learning experiences. I can see the frustrations of both groups (and I know the lines between these two groups are nowhere near as clear-cut as this post indicates). It wil be interesting to see how these two groups interact in this MOOC, or whetehr they are in fact identifiable as two groups in this environment. I&#8217;m learning from both. &#8220;</p>
<p>To view or reply, log in and go to:</p>
<p>http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/groups/paul-is-looking-for-participants-activity-0-2-small-group-reflection/</p>
<p>&#8212;&#8212;&#8212;&#8212;&#8212;&#8212;&#8212;<br />
Your email setting for this group is: All Email<br />

<p>To disable all notifications for this group, click: http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/members/vearg/?bpass-action=unsubscribe&#038;group=2&#038;access_key=0df36c711d1b8cd569a10427e82d2a8d</p>

   ------------------- plaintext -------------------  
 ocTEL 2014
Open Course in Technology Enhanced Learning

* ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ *
! [ocTEL 2014] c.collis replied to one of your updates !
* ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ *
May 5, 2014



	c.collis replied to one of your updates: 

	“Hi Grant: I’m also particularly looking forward to hearing and learning from teachers about their TEL experiences. I’m benefiting from the participation of many ‘technologists’ here because this is their world and they have a wealth of resources and references to share. In practice, I find that sometimes technologists and teachers work at cross purposes: technologists are rightly more focussed on the tech and all the things it can do and how great it would be if we implemented it in our teaching; teachers are more focussed on the subject content and how it can be taught effectively, whether this involves TEL or not. Teachers sometimes feel beseiged by what they perceive as overzealous technologists bombarding them with things they need to add to their already full courses; technologists sometimes feel frustrated at what they perceive as stubborn academics who refuse to try new things that the technologists know could enhance their students’ learning experiences. I can see the frustrations of both groups (and I know the lines between these two groups are nowhere near as clear-cut as this post indicates). It wil be interesting to see how these two groups interact in this MOOC, or whetehr they are in fact identifiable as two groups in this environment. I’m learning from both. “ 

	To view your original update and all comments, log in and visit: http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/activity/p/3112/ 

	———————
To disable these notifications please log in and go to: http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/members/gdoug/settings/notifications/ 

							this mail is brought to you by MailPress

View [http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/newsletter-subscriptions/?view=a68b23c11b354ea49f12810f549a0699&id=71]
Unsubscribe [http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/newsletter-subscriptions/?del=a68b23c11b354ea49f12810f549a0699] 

 ------------------- text/html -------------------  
 <p>c.collis replied to one of your updates:</p>
<p>&#8220;Hi Grant: I&#8217;m also particularly looking forward to hearing and learning from teachers about their TEL experiences. I&#8217;m benefiting from the participation of many &#8216;technologists&#8217; here  because this is their world and they have a wealth of resources and references to share. In practice, I find that sometimes technologists and teachers work at cross purposes: technologists are rightly more focussed on the tech and all the things it can do and how great it would be if we implemented it in our teaching; teachers are more focussed on the subject content and how it can be taught effectively, whether this involves TEL or not. Teachers sometimes feel beseiged by what they perceive as overzealous technologists bombarding them with things they need to add to their already full courses; technologists sometimes feel frustrated at what they perceive as stubborn academics who refuse to try new things that the technologists know could enhance their students&#8217; learning experiences. I can see the frustrations of both groups (and I know the lines between these two groups are nowhere near as clear-cut as this post indicates). It wil be interesting to see how these two groups interact in this MOOC, or whetehr they are in fact identifiable as two groups in this environment. I&#8217;m learning from both. &#8220;</p>
<p>To view your original update and all comments, log in and visit: http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/activity/p/3112/</p>
